Couldn't your manager just run ANT?
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Anna Ska=
winska" <elfeczka@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
>   I've been installing and looki=
ng into all possible programs listed
> at http://www.junit.org/news/extensi=
on/index.htm all afternoon, still
> I can't find any standalone program, al=
lowing to just choose, run and
> watch the results of test in a shiny graph=
ical GUI AND supporting 
> JUnit4.0.
> 
>   What I'm looking for is not a I=
DE-plugin and I know they do the
> task. I need a standalone framework whic=
h would allow my project
> menager to run the tests himself, not having an =
IDE supporting JUnit.
> Something like NUnit provides.
> 
>   Any ideas?
>
